VII. These and all the other precedents of notable 20 severity you have established in your province we should not easily justify except by the most perfect probity. For that reason be as severe as you please in administering justice, provided that your severity is not varied by partiality, but kept on the same level of consistency. However, it is of little importance that your own administration of justice is consistent and careful, unless it be so administered by those also to whom you have yielded any portion of that duty. And indeed it seems to me that there is no great variety of transactions in the government of Asia, but that the entire government mainly depends upon the adminis- tration of justice ; and, being thus limited, the theory of government itself, especially in the provinces, pre- sents no difficulty ; you only need show such consistency and firmness as to withstand not only favouritism‚ but the very suspicion of it.
